item.title: Erin add a quote by John Berger
item.description: "When we read a story, we inhabit it. The covers of the book are like a roof and four walls. What is to happen next will take place within the four walls of the story. And this is possible because the story's voice makes everything its own." -- John Berger

item.title: Erin add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Erin add a quote by Richard Llewellyn
item.description: "O, there is lovely to feel a book, a good book, firm in the hand, for its fatness holds rich promise, and you are hot inside to think of good hours to come." -- Richard Llewellyn

item.title: Erin add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "Man reading should be man intensely alive. The book should be a ball of light in one's hand." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Erin add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means..." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Erin add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Erin add a quote by Muriel Spark
item.description: "To me education is a leading out of what is already there in the pupil's soul." -- Muriel Spark

item.title: Erin add a quote by Walter Mosley
item.description: "A peasant that reads is a prince in waiting." -- Walter Mosley

item.title: Erin add a quote by Alice Munro
item.description: "There is a limit to the amount of misery and disarray you will put up with, for love, just as there is a limit to the amount of mess you can stand around a house. You can't know the limit beforehand, but you will know when you've reached it. I believe this." -- Alice Munro

item.title: Erin add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He never went out without a book under his arm, and he often came back with two." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Erin add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Erin add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Books may well be the only true magic." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Erin add a quote by Hilary Mantel
item.description: "Some of these things are true and some of them lies. But they are all good stories." -- Hilary Mantel

item.title: Erin add a quote by Laura Hillenbrand
item.description: "His books were the closest thing he had to furniture and he lived in them the way other men live in easy chairs." -- Laura Hillenbrand

item.title: Erin add a quote by Caroline Gordon
item.description: "A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way." -- Caroline Gordon
